newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post business - May 8.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post business - May 8.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following stories on the front page of its business section on May 8:
WASHINGTON - New Federal Communications Commission rules could cut long-distance telephone bills by about eight percent, while people with multiple lines can expect higher rates.
NEW YORK - Bond prices were the major culprit behind a sell-off that sent the Dow Jones industrial average down almost 140 points, the first big decline in a week.

WASHINGTON - Ridgewell's, long an institution in Washington's catering community, announced that it has new ownership, a new management team and a new menu that its executives hope will restore the Bethesda company's luster in the area's competitive food industry.
WASHINGTON - In a landmark subsidy for the nations's schools, the FCC adopted a plan to provide more than $2 billion a year in discounts to help educators plug their students into the computer age.
